channel.title: BBC News | News Front Page | UK Edition
channel.description: Visit BBC News for up-to-the-minute news, breaking news, video, audio and feature stories. BBC News provides trusted World and UK news as well as local and regional perspectives. Also entertainment, business, science, technology and health news.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse

item.title: 'Night stalker' suspect remanded
item.description: A man charged with a series of rapes and assaults on elderly people in south-east London over 17 years is remanded in custody.

item.title: Obama presses China over rights
item.description: US President Barack Obama says freedom of expression and worship are "universal rights", on his first visit to China.

item.title: Forest park given Dark Sky honour
item.description: Galloway Forest Park's pitch black nights earn it the honour of becoming the first Dark Sky Park in the UK.

item.title: Poison abortion bid doctor jailed
item.description: A London doctor is jailed for six years for attempting poison his pregnant lover in a bid to induce an abortion.

item.title: Cancel Queen's Speech, says Clegg
item.description: Lib Dem leader Nick Clegg says the government should cancel its legislative programme and focus on cleaning up British politics.

item.title: Australia 'sorry' for child migrant abuse
item.description: Australian PM Kevin Rudd apologises to child migrants who were abused after arriving from the UK in the last century.

item.title: Five arrested during terror raids
item.description: Four men are arrested under the terrorism act after raids in Manchester and Bolton, police say.

item.title: PM to defend UK's Afghan policy
item.description: Gordon Brown will vigorously defend Britain's military policy in Afghanistan by warning al-Qaeda is the UK's biggest threat.

item.title: British troops get delayed Merlin
item.description: The first RAF Merlin helicopter arrives in Afghanistan to provide long-awaited extra air transport for British forces.

item.title: MoD sorry for soldier medal error
item.description: The Ministry of Defence apologises for making a mistake in the inscription on a posthumous medal for a soldier killed in Iraq.

item.title: Reality hits home for Robbie as JLS beat him to number one
item.description: Robbie Williams' comeback album is beaten to the top of the album chart, with boy band JLS going straight in at number one.

item.title: Burley set to lose Scotland post
item.description: George Burley's 22-month reign as boss of Scotland looks like coming to an end this week, BBC Scotland has learned.

item.title: Van Persie faces six-week lay-off
item.description: Arsenal's Robin van Persie is set to be out of action for up to six weeks after suffering an ankle injury on international duty.

item.title: Cook defends England strategy
item.description: England stand-in captain Alastair Cook defends the batting order and his decision-making in the field after South Africa's crushing Twenty20 win.

item.title: Should the Queen’s Speech be cancelled?
item.description: The Lib Dem leader says that the Queen’s Speech should be cancelled in a bid to clean up British politics. Do you agree?

item.title: About my father
item.description: Auschwitz chief's daughter on living with the guilt

item.title: Bryant's Australia
item.description: Did Rudd's apology to child victims shame Britain?

item.title: Back in Bangor
item.description: Snow Patrol's Gary Lightbody goes back to his roots

item.title: dot.life
item.description: Why don't online bullies use their real names?

item.title: In pictures
item.description: Memorial to German goalie Robert Enke

item.title: Biting back
item.description: Taking the fight to UK's loan sharks

item.title: Somalis appeal for pair's release
item.description: Somalis in Britain appeal to pirates holding a Kent couple captive to free them on humanitarian grounds.

item.title: Nursing home blaze inquiry opens
item.description: A fatal accident inquiry into a nursing home fire in Lanarkshire, in which 14 elderly residents died, gets under way.

item.title: Elderly care funding report due
item.description: Proposals from the Welsh Assembly Government on the long-term funding of elderly social care are to be revealed.

item.title: Dublin train gets 'back on track'
item.description: The Belfast to Dublin train service resumes after a collapsed viaduct led to declining passenger numbers and major losses.

item.title: 'Africa must think big to thrive'
item.description: Many African countries are too small to continue to exist independently, Sudan-born magnate Mo Ibrahim says.

item.title: Colombia frees Venezuelan guards
item.description: Colombia releases four Venezuelan national guard members who crossed the border into Colombian territory.

item.title: Russia's Iran reactor 'delayed'
item.description: Russia says a new nuclear reactor it is building in southern Iran will not be completed by the end of the year as planned.

item.title: Burma's Suu Kyi calls for talks
item.description: Burmese pro-democracy leader Aung San Suu Kyi calls for direct talks with the country's military leader Than Shwe.

item.title: Monitors to rule on Kosovo vote
item.description: Election officials are set to confirm the winner of Kosovo's first poll since it declared independence last year.

item.title: Four dead in Peshawar explosion
item.description: Four people are killed and a number injured in an explosion outside a police station in the Pakistani city of Peshawar.

item.title: Bonus crackdown plan 'dangerous'
item.description: A plan to give the City watchdog powers over pay is a "dangerous route to go down", a former RBS chairman tells the BBC.

item.title: Tory faces deselection meeting
item.description: The future of a Tory parliamentary candidate who had an affair with an MP is to be decided at a meeting later.

item.title: Warning over 'cosmetic ops risk'
item.description: Lack of regulation and "professional greed" puts cosmetic surgery patients at greater risk, a doctor warns.

item.title: Bitter divorcees 'using children'
item.description: Children in England are often caught up in vindictive legal action by divorcing parents, a survey suggests.

item.title: Apec leaders drop climate target
item.description: Asia-Pacific leaders say it will not be possible to reach a climate change deal ahead of the UN conference in Copenhagen.

item.title: 'Afro' rocker voted off X Factor
item.description: Rock singer Jamie Archer is voted off TV talent show The X Factor, the first of Simon Cowell's over 25s group to leave the programme.

item.title: UN slated for stifling net debate
item.description: The UN is criticised for stifling debate about net censorship after it disrupts a meeting of free-speech advocates in Egypt.
